TopicTitle: [1.7.3] Exploration Rover System by A.S.E.T. v0.3 (04.08.19)

Articles.Content: Anyone tried this with 1.05 yet?
Yes it works you need a up to date Firespitter plugin and JSI PartUtilities the only thing, I found was the TransparentPod not working.
SWEET!

On 10/8/2015 at 7:51 AM, johnnyhandsome said:

Ok, I've added the code to the config file to store science. Now that my planetary science collecting is over and I have 112 individual science reports, how do I move them from the ERS to rocket home? There doesn't seem to be an option for a Kerbal to collect the science to move it.

Did you have any luck with this?

3 hours ago, Reidsb said:

Did you have any luck with this?

You can make a MM to add 

	MODULE
	{
		name = ModuleScienceExperiment
		experimentID = crewReport
		experimentActionName = Crew Report
		resetActionName = Discard Crew Report
		reviewActionName = Review Report
		useStaging = False
		useActionGroups = True
		hideUIwhenUnavailable = True
		rerunnable = True
		xmitDataScalar = 1.0
		usageReqMaskInternal = 5
		usageReqMaskExternal = -1
	}
	MODULE
	{
		name = ModuleScienceContainer
		reviewActionName = Review Stored Data
		storeActionName = Store Experiments
		evaOnlyStorage = True
		storageRange = 1.6
	}
That worked. Thanks!
Man, KSP 1.1 sounds like it might be death of this very cool and useful mod.

On ‎2‎/‎28‎/‎2016 at 5:24 AM, johnnyhandsome said:

Man, KSP 1.1 sounds like it might be death of this very cool and useful mod.

Is this working? I made a rover following the video and it wont drive, wheels are spinning but it just slowly drifts accross the ground.

4 minutes ago, Dazza23 said:

Is this working? I made a rover following the video and it wont drive, wheels are spinning but it just slowly drifts accross the ground.

When KSP went to Unity 5, the wheel colliders (and I guess the mechanics, too) went to pot with it. So, you won't find an update of this until the wheel situation is fixed. Works fine in 1.0.5, though.
